MCQ: What is the main difference between data science and data analysis?
Choices: a: Data science focuses on structured data while data analysis focuses on unstructured data; b: Data science involves statistical, computational, and machine learning methods while data analysis involves examination and interpretation of data; c: Data science is more focused on patterns and trends while data analysis is more focused on predictive modeling; d: Data science and data analysis are essentially the same

MCQ: What is the role of a data scientist in the field of data management and analysis?
Choices: a: To only analyze existing data; b: To develop and implement predictive models; c: To focus on structured datasets only; d: To communicate findings to technical audiences only

MCQ: Which of the following is NOT a task typically involved in data analysis?
Choices: a: Data cleaning; b: Data visualization; c: Feature engineering; d: Exploratory data analysis
